snippet: Permira, which acquired the German fashion brand in 2007, planned to sell 4.9 million shares in a private placement, representing a 7 percent stake. It will be left with a 32 percent stake.
abstract: Permira, which acquired the German fashion brand in 2007, planned to sell 4.9 million shares in a private placement, representing a 7 percent stake. It will be left with a 32 percent stake.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – The private equity firm Permira has further reduced its stake in Hugo Boss, the second time it has decreased its holdings in the German fashion brand this year.

headline.main: Private Equity Firm Permira Further Reduces Stake in Hugo Boss
